org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game
Class SmallProgressMeasureSolver

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
      org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game.AbstractGameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>
          org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game.SmallProgressMeasureSolver
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener, GameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>
public class SmallProgressMeasureSolver
extends AbstractGameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>

This class provides an implementation of the solver for parity games based on small progress measure in [Marcin Jurdziński: Small Progress Measures for Solving Parity Games. STACS 2000: 290-301]. In this implementation, to get the solution for GamePlayer.P1, there is no need to take the dual of the game and solve the dual for GamePlayer.P0 (actually for GamePlayer.P1 in the original game because of the dual). Instead, the roles of game players can be specified as a parameter.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

          A progress measure is a map from a state to its tuple.

setInitialProgressMeasure

public void setInitialProgressMeasure(GamePlayer player,
                                      SmallProgressMeasureSolver.ProgressMeasure pm)
Sets the initial progress measure used in the fixpoint procedure progressMeasureLifting(Game, StateSet, GamePlayer). If the option O_REUSE_PREVIOUS_PROGRESS_MEASURE is on, the initial progress measure may be overwritten.

Parameters:
player - a game player
pm - an initial progress measure for the game player

public SmallProgressMeasureSolver.ProgressMeasure lift(Game game,
                                                       StateSet subgame,
                                                       GamePlayer player,
                                                       SmallProgressMeasureSolver.ProgressMeasure pm,
                                                       GameState v)
This method corresponds to the function Lift(pm, v) in the paper.

Parameters:
game - a parity game
subgame - the states of a subgame in the parity game
player - the game player which the solver is going to solve the parity game for
pm - a progress measure
v - a state in the subgame
Returns:
Lift(pm, v)

public SmallProgressMeasureSolver.ProgressMeasure progressMeasureLifting(Game game,
                                                                         StateSet subgame,
                                                                         GamePlayer player,
                                                                         SmallProgressMeasureSolver.ProgressMeasure pm)
This method corresponds to the procedure ProgressMeasureLifting but the initial progress measure is specified as an argument.

Parameters:

player - the game player which the solver is going to solve the parity game for
pm - the initial progress measure
Returns:
the fixpoint of lift(Game, StateSet, GamePlayer, ProgressMeasure, GameState)

progressMeasureLifting

public SmallProgressMeasureSolver.ProgressMeasure progressMeasureLifting(Game game,
                                                                         StateSet subgame,
                                                                         GamePlayer player)
This method corresponds to the procedure ProgressMeasureLifting. If the option O_REUSE_PREVIOUS_PROGRESS_MEASURE is on, then this procedure will start with the previous computed progress measure. Otherwise if the method setInitialProgressMeasure(GamePlayer, ProgressMeasure) is called, the specified progress measure will be used as the start.

Parameters:
game - a parity game
subgame - the states of a subgame in the parity game
player - the game player which the solver is going to solve the parity game for
Returns:
the fixpoint of lift(Game, StateSet, GamePlayer, ProgressMeasure, GameState)
